channel.title: At my whits end
channel.description:
The other day my desktop computer, which has been needing a reformat for a while now just to get it back to near-new condition and stop the occasional Blue Screen of Death cropping up, got a virus. I don't blame it, I mean not installing virus protection isn't a good idea.
So I got onto my laptop, downloaded me a real fine looking torrent of Windows XP pro. Got that ISO burned to a dvd and shoved [s]my dick[/s] the dvd into the drive.
I set the first boot device to DVD. I pressed any key to boot to the DVD. I created a 20GB/80GB partition on my hard drive and began formatting with NTFS. It got to that point where the wolf howls at the moon and the computer screen reads : "Rebooting in: 14 seconds, press the Enter key to reboot now".
It was time to boot into Windows for the very first time.
I got past the boot screen, past the Windows XP loading screen to. The next screen was a one I shall not be telling my grand children about. Nor my children.
It was the BLUE SCREEN OF DEATH. Horrifyingly I fell to the floor next to my computer tower and slapped the front, trying, praying to find the reset button. Luckily my right index finger was exactly on target and the strange drone of my computers fans began again.
Those 14 seconds waiting for my fate to be decided were the worst of my life. Only to be met with the once again same horrifying screen of blue. It was a wall, blocking my way to the internet where all of my wildest dreams come true.
Now I decided to myself, I though, and thunk, and thunk_ some more.
"I must, to the old installation disk, try once more I must."
So it was time to find my old XP home installation disk. The one with a valid key that I purchased myself all those years ago. I found it swiftly from my bottom drawer and plugged it in.
This time I didn't even get so far. Everytime I boot up into the windows xp disk it gets to the screen where it ask if I want to Install, Repair or Exit. It stays on that screen for a few seconds and then my computer switches itself off.
I've tried everything it wont work. Just switches itself off. I've taken all uneeded hardware out, I've switched to a different hard drive, i've switched ram.
The only thing I think it could be is my mother board has some how topped itself.
HALP PLZ

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“maniown, post:14, topic:226173”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=297138.msg2387611#msg2387611 date=1218840636]

Try praying. My laptop just completely died the other day - post was like half the screen size, and dint even get to the loading screen.

So I prayed to god for my laptop to work again, switched it on and it worked exactly the same as before it broke.

At the cost of your soul.
[/quote]

and his dignity.[/quote]
and my axe.

Also: Yeah pretty sure my computers problem is that the things that attach the heatsink to my board have snapped and it is falling lose. My computer runs fine when i run it on its side though (gravity keeping the heatsink/fan on the processor). So i guess I need to get a new one.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:3, topic:226173”][quote author=magma link=topic=297138.msg2387578#msg2387578 date=1218839158]
Try praying. My laptop just completely died the other day - post was like half the screen size, and dint even get to the loading screen.

So I prayed to god for my laptop to work again, switched it on and it worked exactly the same as before it broke.
[/quote]

At the cost of your soul.[/quote]

and his dignity.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Strange. I only ever get a BSOD when I brag about never getting any.
I have had like one on vista and like three on XP

@The ram error guy:
That can’t be right. I had lots of screwed ram sticks in my pc. The only thing they did wrong was make me need to reset the BIOS every time I started the comp.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Right i’m short of time right at this second so I’ll just say: I fixed the problem, don’t know how but my desktop computer installed windows fine somehow.

I think it may have been my processor heat sink and fan that was loose.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Once you get Ubuntu working (by the way, sense you don’t know about it much, it is a linux distro so look up some linux guides), you would have been able to mount your windows partition and rip your files off before erasing them. Shame.

Other than that…when you get the blue screen this is the most common problems :

  1. RAM. This is the most common issue EVER. One ram problem, and hello blue screen.

  2. Video card. Some people say the HDD for 2, I say the Video card. A corrupted driver or no video card being detected is insta blue screen.

  3. HDD, you need one xD.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Ah good, my mums computer is back to normal. Doesn’t even make sense, all I did was remove all but one ram and then boot up. Then I put all of the ram back in and it works as normal.

Just download ubuntu, the disk came with a memtest so I’m running that now on my ram to check that its not that.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:7, topic:226173”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=297138.msg2389701#msg2389701 date=1218925486]
Have you tried to boot in safe mode? if that works, go download new mobo drivers from internet. sux2bu
[/quote]
Lol I can’t boot in to safe mode because there is now no OS on my hard drive.

The problem is still there, I even stupidly tried putting my hard drive in my mums computer to install windows on my hard drive and then put the drive back into my computer. I didn’t realize that would fuck up my mums computer too.

Just downloading ubuntu now.[/quote]

Try using your moms HD, maybe your own HD is fucked up or something.

Read full topic

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

get slax on ure memory stick its nothing great but its better then no OS

slax.org

Slax Linux - your pocket operating system

Slax is a modern, portable, small and fast Linux operating system.


http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2006/09/20/all-in-one-usb-slaxzip/

Read full topic

The problem is still there, I even stupidly tried putting my hard drive in my mums computer to install windows on my hard drive and then put the drive back into my computer. I didn’t realize that would fuck up my mums computer too.

Just downloading ubuntu now.

@davidude36 wrote:

Thanks for the replies guys. I don’t know much about ubuntu, is it a free OS that you just download and burn to disk?

item.title: At my whits end
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Try installing Ubuntu. If that fails, then you know you have fucked up hardware, if it works…then we have just proven more conclusively that windows sucks.

Also, I find semen can clog up the small motors in optical drives…just saying

Read full topic
